snippet: The potential deal raises the possibility of a clash between the House and Senate versions of the legislation, just weeks before the fund could go broke.
abstract: House and Senate committees draft competing plans to replenish national Highway Trust Fund before it becomes insolvent Aug 1; both plans would provide $11 billion to keep fund running until May 2015, but differences in provisions set up confrontation that could stop work on tens of thousands of infrastructure projects.
lead_paragraph: The potential deal raises the possibility of a clash between the House and Senate versions of the legislation, just weeks before the fund could go broke.

headline.main: House and Senate Committees Offer Competing Rescue Plans for Highway Fund
headline.print_headline: House and Senate Committees Offer Competing Rescue Plans for Highway Fund
